revised_title: Investigating the Ionosphere's Influence on Radio Waves from Artificial Earth Satellites
tldr: The article discusses the observations and analysis of radio waves emitted by Russian artificial earth satellites and their interaction with the ionosphere. The authors explore the Doppler effect, Faraday effect, and wave refraction to understand the ionosphere's influence on radio waves. They conclude that accurate measurements of the Doppler effect and angle of incidence, along with a well-known satellite orbit, can provide valuable information about the ionization density at the satellite.
